comment: Ganser is probably one of the most caring professor's you find in the biology department. She really cares about her student's success and will do anything she can to make sure you understand the material. Her tests make you think but she goes over all the material in her lecture. If you can take her, DO IT because she will help you in the future!

Professor Ganser was one of the best professors I have ever had the pleasure of learning under. She has such a great sense of humor and the learning environment is incredibly welcoming when the professor connects well to the students. In addition, there was a lot of material but she does her best to make sure we learn every aspect of it.

She is a great and knowledgeable person. The class was online and consisted of 2 exams, 3 lab practicals, and a final exam. All her exams were free response but came straight from her lecture ppts. Her class is not memorization so you have to apply the information to the scenarios she gives.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Accessible outside class--Gives good feedback

comment: She is a great person, and solidly good professor. She can be a bit all over the place in terms of lecture and test dates. She will give you a calendar at the beginning of the semester, but it is more of a general guideline. Tests are long, I spent four hours on one, but interesting. She is very understanding, and all around very interesting.

Loved this professor! Memorization will not cut it for this class. You have to APPLY the information to different scenarios on exams. Grades consist of 3 exams, a cumulative final, and quizzes. Record lectures! I didn't use the book. Made an A in the class.

If you have the chance, take her! She is the best professor I have taken at KSU. Her exams are all free response, and she makes you think. You have to be able to connect things to each other, but if you get stuck, you can ask her and she will give you a hint or tell you if you are going in the right direction. She really cares about her students.

Dr. G loves to teach and it shows. She genuinely wants you to learn not just memorize. Her lectures arent mandatory but theyre extremely helpful. Shes makes the material practical, understandable, and interesting. Shes always available if you need help, have questions or just to talk. Highly recommend!!!

Dr. Ganser is hilarious and engaging every class. Attendance isnt mandatory but 100% recommended. She loves her subject and will answer any question you throw at her. Grade is mainly tests, which are always free response. Know the lecture material well and she does give partial credit.

Lisa Ganser is AMAZING! She is such an angel, and she is one of the most caring professors that I have had. Her tests are all free response, so you better start working on your writing stamina. Her lectures are very detailed, and she highly encourages critical thinking using your knowledge rather than just memorizing. She also a huge Spongebob fan!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Dr. Ganser is overall a great professor. If you go to class, you will actually learn a lot. Her notes can be a little all over the place, and she can be pretty crude, but she makes her class interesting. Lab is difficult (spelling counts) but if you put in the effort, you'll be fine. Overall, I would take her again, just be prepared to study!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. G is an awesome professor! She always tries to make the class interesting and she is very approachable. She is not one of those stuck-up professors that think their brain was hand delivered by God. But her tests are difficult and you must attend the lectures to do well. Her tests are not memorization, they are focused on applying the material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved Dr. G class. This is human physiology though so you MUST study. Its not easy, but Dr. G makes it so fun and interesting with her sarcasm and stories. I looked forward to her MWF 9am. You have to have a true understanding of the material to do well. Record lectures, takes notes, ask questions. Dont get behind! I got a B with diligent work
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Ganser is awesome and she really helped me with biology.  I could sit and watch her lecture all day. She should get a Nobel for all the work she has done to help frogs, fish and other creatures.

Honestly this lady is horrible. she doesn't know the subject and on top of that she goes in circle so its kinda confusing. Best way to pass her class is to record her lecture study the ppt and review the question in the back of the book.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr Ganser is a fun person who can make class entertaining. But as far as getting the information across clearly she leaves a lot to be desired. The Pwrpnts she puts on D2L are often not the ones she uses in class. Test questions are sometimes worded confusingly, however she does give partial credit. Don't buy the book. I suggest Dr Hesser for CVA.

She is not the best. I would recommend a different prof for this class. She is a very nice lady but not a great prof. Teaches this class as if it were only about humans. Powerpoints posted afterwards. TAKE DETAILED NOTES, but she goes to fast to facilitate that. Lab is easy, except the Cat practical.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Ganser is the absolute best! She is hilarious and very clear about her expectations. The test are tough, but very fair and she gives you a good clue as to what will be on each exam. Go to every class and just read your notes for the tests. Lab is gross, but she makes it very clear. HIGHLY RECOMMEND HER!!!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Excellent and talented professor when it comes to teaching. I learned more in this class than any other class at KSU. However... also the most unprofessional professor I have ever had. Conversations often deviate to something vulgar, like barf or booze. Admittedly vindictive to students who don't show even though participation not in syllabus.

Tests are not too bad. comes straight from the lecture notes. no textbook needed but it can be helpful. But you DO NEED the lab textbook. She will try to help you the best she can. always replies to emails.
Loved Dr. Ganser, she knew what she was talking about and most lectures kept you focused. In lab she is fun and helps all the time.

She's the best! The class isn't the easiest, but she loves what she teaches and she is willing to help as much as possible! You do have to study, but if you apply yourself and pay attention in class, you should make a good grade. I say this class is not mandatory because you get no grade for it, but you should definitely go to class.

Very laid back teacher who knows her stuff and likes what she does. Material is hard, but ppts are posted and she allows recorders if you want to make sure you catch everything. Lab was fun and she gave extra credit questions on lab tests and lecture tests.
